definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
variant of 匹[pi3]/classifier for cloth: bolt
classifier for horses, mules etc/Taiwan pr. [pi1]/ordinary person/classifier for cloth: bolt/horsepower
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)

sentences.english: You should take some aspirins to allay your fever.
sentences.chinese: 你需要退热，你应该吃些阿司匹林。

sentences.english: There is indication to use Asprin, and it is better to use it.
sentences.chinese: 应用阿司匹林有指正，用比不用好。

sentences.english: Objective To study the pharmacokinetics of aspirin sustained-release tablets containing chitosan.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究阿司匹林壳聚糖缓释片的体内药物动力学。

sentences.english: I'm sorry to hear that.Do you want some aspirin?
sentences.chinese: 听到这个消息我很难过，你需要一些阿司匹林吗？

sentences.english: I'm giving you some antibiotics and aspirins.
sentences.chinese: 给你开一些抗生素和阿司匹林。

sentences.english: Overall, with medical opinion divided, the feeling is that the public will need to make up their own minds about whether to take low dose aspirin.
sentences.chinese: 总之，公众需要自己决定是否服用低剂量的阿司匹林。

sentences.english: To reduce inflammation, take an aspirin or ibuprofen at mealtime.
sentences.chinese: 为了减少发炎，吃饭时候服用阿司匹林或布洛芬。

sentences.english: Women may not benefit as much from aspirin therapy as men.
sentences.chinese: 女性或许不象男性那样从阿司匹林一样受益。

sentences.english: Why don’t you take an aspirin?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不吃一片阿司匹林呢？

sentences.english: Take an aspirin when you've got a fever.
sentences.chinese: 发烧时服一片阿司匹林。

sentences.english: Researchers has found that the benefits of taking aspirin regularly differs between men and women.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员发现阿司匹林的药效男女有别。

sentences.english: And there were more cases of stomach bleeding in the women who took aspirin than in those who did not.
sentences.chinese: 另外，服用阿司匹林的实验对象有更多胃出血的情况。

sentences.english: If I have a headache, I will take an aspirin.
sentences.chinese: 我要是头疼的话就会服用一片阿司匹林。

sentences.english: He felt better after sweating himself by taking APC.
sentences.chinese: 吃过阿司匹林发了一身汗后，他感到好受多了。

sentences.english: If you've got light injuries and you need bandages or aspirins , you'll get seen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你碰到轻伤和你需要绷带或阿司匹林，你将被看。

definition: aspirin (loanword) (variant of 阿司匹林[a1 si1 pi3 lin2])
to take medicine orally/oral (contraceptive etc)/to say that one is convinced
Ibuprofen or Nurofen/also called 異丁苯丙酸|异丁苯丙酸
diclofenac sodium, a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug used to reduce swelling and as painkiller/also called voltaren 扶他林
